14/*
15 * memline.c: Contains the functions for appending, deleting and changing the
16 * text lines. The memfile functions are used to store the information in
17 * blocks of memory, backed up by a file. The structure of the information is
18 * a tree. The root of the tree is a pointer block. The leaves of the tree
19 * are data blocks. In between may be several layers of pointer blocks,
20 * forming branches.
21 *
22 * Three types of blocks are used:
23 * - Block nr 0 contains information for recovery
24 * - Pointer blocks contain list of pointers to other blocks.
25 * - Data blocks contain the actual text.
26 *
27 * Block nr 0 contains the block0 structure (see below).
28 *
29 * Block nr 1 is the first pointer block. It is the root of the tree.
30 * Other pointer blocks are branches.
31 *
32 * If a line is too big to fit in a single page, the block containing that
33 * line is made big enough to hold the line. It may span several pages.
34 * Otherwise all blocks are one page.
35 *
36 * A data block that was filled when starting to edit a file and was not
37 * changed since then, can have a negative block number. This means that it
38 * has not yet been assigned a place in the file. When recovering, the lines
39 * in this data block can be read from the original file. When the block is
40 * changed (lines appended/deleted/changed) or when it is flushed it gets a
41 * positive number. Use mf_trans_del() to get the new number, before calling
42 * mf_get().
43 */
44
45#include "vim.h"
46
47#ifndef UNIX1 // it's in os_unix.h for Unix
48# include <time.h>
49#endif
50
51#if defined(SASC) || defined(__amigaos4__)
52# include <proto/dos.h> // for Open() and Close()
53#endif

55typedef struct block0 ZERO_BL; // contents of the first block
56typedef struct pointer_block PTR_BL; // contents of a pointer block
57typedef struct data_block DATA_BL; // contents of a data block
58typedef struct pointer_entry PTR_EN; // block/line-count pair
59
60#define DATA_ID(('d' << 8) + 'a') (('d' << 8) + 'a') // data block id
61#define PTR_ID(('p' << 8) + 't') (('p' << 8) + 't') // pointer block id
62#define BLOCK0_ID0'b' 'b' // block 0 id 0
63#define BLOCK0_ID1'0' '0' // block 0 id 1
64#define BLOCK0_ID1_C0'c' 'c' // block 0 id 1 'cm' 0
65#define BLOCK0_ID1_C1'C' 'C' // block 0 id 1 'cm' 1
66#define BLOCK0_ID1_C2'd' 'd' // block 0 id 1 'cm' 2
67
68#if defined(FEAT_CRYPT)
69static int id1_codes[] = {
70 BLOCK0_ID1_C0'c', // CRYPT_M_ZIP
71 BLOCK0_ID1_C1'C', // CRYPT_M_BF
72 BLOCK0_ID1_C2'd', // CRYPT_M_BF2
73};
74#endif

76/*
77 * pointer to a block, used in a pointer block
78 */
79struct pointer_entry
80{
81 blocknr_T pe_bnum; // block number
82 linenr_T pe_line_count; // number of lines in this branch
83 linenr_T pe_old_lnum; // lnum for this block (for recovery)
84 int pe_page_count; // number of pages in block pe_bnum
85};
86
87/*
88 * A pointer block contains a list of branches in the tree.
89 */
90struct pointer_block
91{
92 short_u pb_id; // ID for pointer block: PTR_ID
93 short_u pb_count; // number of pointers in this block
94 short_u pb_count_max; // maximum value for pb_count
95 PTR_EN pb_pointer[1]; // list of pointers to blocks (actually longer)
96 // followed by empty space until end of page
97};
98
99/*
100 * A data block is a leaf in the tree.
101 *
102 * The text of the lines is at the end of the block. The text of the first line
103 * in the block is put at the end, the text of the second line in front of it,
104 * etc. Thus the order of the lines is the opposite of the line number.
105 */
106struct data_block
107{
108 short_u db_id; // ID for data block: DATA_ID
109 unsigned db_free; // free space available
110 unsigned db_txt_start; // byte where text starts
111 unsigned db_txt_end; // byte just after data block
112 linenr_T db_line_count; // number of lines in this block
113 unsigned db_index[1]; // index for start of line (actually bigger)
114 // followed by empty space up to db_txt_start
115 // followed by the text in the lines until
116 // end of page
117};
118
119/*
120 * The low bits of db_index hold the actual index. The topmost bit is
121 * used for the global command to be able to mark a line.
122 * This method is not clean, but otherwise there would be at least one extra
123 * byte used for each line.
124 * The mark has to be in this place to keep it with the correct line when other
125 * lines are inserted or deleted.
126 */
127#define DB_MARKED((unsigned)1 << ((sizeof(unsigned) * 8) - 1)) ((unsigned)1 << ((sizeof(unsigned) * 8) - 1))
128#define DB_INDEX_MASK(~((unsigned)1 << ((sizeof(unsigned) * 8) - 1))) (~DB_MARKED((unsigned)1 << ((sizeof(unsigned) * 8) - 1)))
129
130#define INDEX_SIZE(sizeof(unsigned)) (sizeof(unsigned)) // size of one db_index entry
131#define HEADER_SIZE(sizeof(DATA_BL) - (sizeof(unsigned))) (sizeof(DATA_BL) - INDEX_SIZE(sizeof(unsigned))) // size of data block header
132
133#define B0_FNAME_SIZE_ORG900 900 // what it was in older versions
134#define B0_FNAME_SIZE_NOCRYPT898 898 // 2 bytes used for other things
135#define B0_FNAME_SIZE_CRYPT890 890 // 10 bytes used for other things
136#define B0_UNAME_SIZE40 40
137#define B0_HNAME_SIZE40 40
138/*
139 * Restrict the numbers to 32 bits, otherwise most compilers will complain.
140 * This won't detect a 64 bit machine that only swaps a byte in the top 32
141 * bits, but that is crazy anyway.
142 */
143#define B0_MAGIC_LONG0x30313233L 0x30313233L
144#define B0_MAGIC_INT0x20212223L 0x20212223L
145#define B0_MAGIC_SHORT0x10111213L 0x10111213L
146#define B0_MAGIC_CHAR0x55 0x55

148/*
149 * Block zero holds all info about the swap file.
150 *
151 * NOTE: DEFINITION OF BLOCK 0 SHOULD NOT CHANGE! It would make all existing
152 * swap files unusable!
153 *
154 * If size of block0 changes anyway, adjust MIN_SWAP_PAGE_SIZE in vim.h!!
155 *
156 * This block is built up of single bytes, to make it portable across
157 * different machines. b0_magic_* is used to check the byte order and size of
158 * variables, because the rest of the swap file is not portable.
159 */
160struct block0
161{
162 char_u b0_id[2]; // id for block 0: BLOCK0_ID0 and BLOCK0_ID1,
163 // BLOCK0_ID1_C0, BLOCK0_ID1_C1, etc.
164 char_u b0_version[10]; // Vim version string
165 char_u b0_page_size[4];// number of bytes per page
166 char_u b0_mtime[4]; // last modification time of file
167 char_u b0_ino[4]; // inode of b0_fname
168 char_u b0_pid[4]; // process id of creator (or 0)
169 char_u b0_uname[B0_UNAME_SIZE40]; // name of user (uid if no name)
170 char_u b0_hname[B0_HNAME_SIZE40]; // host name (if it has a name)
171 char_u b0_fname[B0_FNAME_SIZE_ORG900]; // name of file being edited
172 long b0_magic_long; // check for byte order of long
173 int b0_magic_int; // check for byte order of int
174 short b0_magic_short; // check for byte order of short
175 char_u b0_magic_char; // check for last char
176};
177
178/*
179 * Note: b0_dirty and b0_flags are put at the end of the file name. For very
180 * long file names in older versions of Vim they are invalid.
181 * The 'fileencoding' comes before b0_flags, with a NUL in front. But only
182 * when there is room, for very long file names it's omitted.
183 */
184#define B0_DIRTY0x55 0x55
185#define b0_dirtyb0_fname[900 - 1] b0_fname[B0_FNAME_SIZE_ORG900 - 1]
186
187/*
188 * The b0_flags field is new in Vim 7.0.
189 */
190#define b0_flagsb0_fname[900 - 2] b0_fname[B0_FNAME_SIZE_ORG900 - 2]
191
192/*
193 * Crypt seed goes here, 8 bytes. New in Vim 7.3.
194 * Without encryption these bytes may be used for 'fenc'.
195 */
196#define b0_seedb0_fname[900 - 2 - 8] b0_fname[B0_FNAME_SIZE_ORG900 - 2 - MF_SEED_LEN8]
197
198// The lowest two bits contain the fileformat. Zero means it's not set
199// (compatible with Vim 6.x), otherwise it's EOL_UNIX + 1, EOL_DOS + 1 or
200// EOL_MAC + 1.
201#define B0_FF_MASK3 3
202
203// Swap file is in directory of edited file. Used to find the file from
204// different mount points.
205#define B0_SAME_DIR4 4
206
207// The 'fileencoding' is at the end of b0_fname[], with a NUL in front of it.
208// When empty there is only the NUL.
209#define B0_HAS_FENC8 8

211#define STACK_INCR5 5 // nr of entries added to ml_stack at a time

219static linenr_T lowest_marked = 0;

266/*
267 * Open a new memline for "buf".
268 *
269 * Return FAIL for failure, OK otherwise.
270 */
271 int
272ml_open(buf_T *buf)
273{
274 memfile_T *mfp;
275 bhdr_T *hp = NULL((void*)0);
276 ZERO_BL *b0p;
277 PTR_BL *pp;
278 DATA_BL *dp;
279
280 /*
281 * init fields in memline struct
282 */
283 buf->b_ml.ml_stack_size = 0; // no stack yet
284 buf->b_ml.ml_stack = NULL((void*)0); // no stack yet
285 buf->b_ml.ml_stack_top = 0; // nothing in the stack
286 buf->b_ml.ml_locked = NULL((void*)0); // no cached block
287 buf->b_ml.ml_line_lnum = 0; // no cached line
288#ifdef FEAT_BYTEOFF
289 buf->b_ml.ml_chunksize = NULL((void*)0);
290#endif
291
292 if (cmdmod.cmod_flags & CMOD_NOSWAPFILE0x2000)
293 buf->b_p_swf = FALSE0;
294
295 /*
296 * When 'updatecount' is non-zero swap file may be opened later.
297 */
298 if (p_uc && buf->b_p_swf)
299 buf->b_may_swap = TRUE1;
300 else
301 buf->b_may_swap = FALSE0;
302
303 /*
304 * Open the memfile. No swap file is created yet.
305 */
306 mfp = mf_open(NULL((void*)0), 0);
307 if (mfp == NULL((void*)0))
308 goto error;
309
310 buf->b_ml.ml_mfp = mfp;
311#ifdef FEAT_CRYPT
312 mfp->mf_buffer = buf;
313#endif
314 buf->b_ml.ml_flags = ML_EMPTY1;
315 buf->b_ml.ml_line_count = 1;
316#ifdef FEAT_LINEBREAK
317 curwin->w_nrwidth_line_count = 0;
318#endif
319
320/*
321 * fill block0 struct and write page 0
322 */
323 if ((hp = mf_new(mfp, FALSE0, 1)) == NULL((void*)0))
324 goto error;
325 if (hp->bh_bnumbh_hashitem.mhi_key != 0)
326 {
327 iemsg(_("E298: Didn't get block nr 0?")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E298: Didn't get block nr 0?"
), 5));
328 goto error;
329 }
330 b0p = (ZERO_BL *)(hp->bh_data);
331
332 b0p->b0_id[0] = BLOCK0_ID0'b';
333 b0p->b0_id[1] = BLOCK0_ID1'0';
334 b0p->b0_magic_long = (long)B0_MAGIC_LONG0x30313233L;
335 b0p->b0_magic_int = (int)B0_MAGIC_INT0x20212223L;
336 b0p->b0_magic_short = (short)B0_MAGIC_SHORT0x10111213L;
337 b0p->b0_magic_char = B0_MAGIC_CHAR0x55;
338 mch_memmove(b0p->b0_version, "VIM ", 4)memmove((char *)(b0p->b0_version), (char *)("VIM "), 4);
339 STRNCPY(b0p->b0_version + 4, Version, 6)strncpy((char *)(b0p->b0_version + 4), (char *)(Version), (
size_t)(6));
340 long_to_char((long)mfp->mf_page_size, b0p->b0_page_size);
341
342#ifdef FEAT_SPELL
343 if (!buf->b_spell)
344#endif
345 {
346 b0p->b0_dirtyb0_fname[900 - 1] = buf->b_changed ? B0_DIRTY0x55 : 0;
347 b0p->b0_flagsb0_fname[900 - 2] = get_fileformat(buf) + 1;
348 set_b0_fname(b0p, buf);
349 (void)get_user_name(b0p->b0_uname, B0_UNAME_SIZE40);
350 b0p->b0_uname[B0_UNAME_SIZE40 - 1] = NUL'\000';
351 mch_get_host_name(b0p->b0_hname, B0_HNAME_SIZE40);
352 b0p->b0_hname[B0_HNAME_SIZE40 - 1] = NUL'\000';
353 long_to_char(mch_get_pid(), b0p->b0_pid);
354#ifdef FEAT_CRYPT
355 ml_set_b0_crypt(buf, b0p);
356#endif
357 }
358
359 /*
360 * Always sync block number 0 to disk, so we can check the file name in
361 * the swap file in findswapname(). Don't do this for a help files or
362 * a spell buffer though.
363 * Only works when there's a swapfile, otherwise it's done when the file
364 * is created.
365 */
366 mf_put(mfp, hp, TRUE1, FALSE0);
367 if (!buf->b_help && !B_SPELL(buf)((buf)->b_spell))
368 (void)mf_sync(mfp, 0);
369
370 /*
371 * Fill in root pointer block and write page 1.
372 */
373 if ((hp = ml_new_ptr(mfp)) == NULL((void*)0))
374 goto error;
375 if (hp->bh_bnumbh_hashitem.mhi_key != 1)
376 {
377 iemsg(_("E298: Didn't get block nr 1?")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E298: Didn't get block nr 1?"
), 5));
378 goto error;
379 }
380 pp = (PTR_BL *)(hp->bh_data);
381 pp->pb_count = 1;
382 pp->pb_pointer[0].pe_bnum = 2;
383 pp->pb_pointer[0].pe_page_count = 1;
384 pp->pb_pointer[0].pe_old_lnum = 1;
385 pp->pb_pointer[0].pe_line_count = 1; // line count after insertion
386 mf_put(mfp, hp, TRUE1, FALSE0);
387
388 /*
389 * Allocate first data block and create an empty line 1.
390 */
391 if ((hp = ml_new_data(mfp, FALSE0, 1)) == NULL((void*)0))
392 goto error;
393 if (hp->bh_bnumbh_hashitem.mhi_key != 2)
394 {
395 iemsg(_("E298: Didn't get block nr 2?")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E298: Didn't get block nr 2?"
), 5));
396 goto error;
397 }
398
399 dp = (DATA_BL *)(hp->bh_data);
400 dp->db_index[0] = --dp->db_txt_start; // at end of block
401 dp->db_free -= 1 + INDEX_SIZE(sizeof(unsigned));
402 dp->db_line_count = 1;
403 *((char_u *)dp + dp->db_txt_start) = NUL'\000'; // empty line
404
405 return OK1;
406
407error:
408 if (mfp != NULL((void*)0))
409 {
410 if (hp)
411 mf_put(mfp, hp, FALSE0, FALSE0);
412 mf_close(mfp, TRUE1); // will also free(mfp->mf_fname)
413 }
414 buf->b_ml.ml_mfp = NULL((void*)0);
415 return FAIL0;
416}

418#if defined(FEAT_CRYPT) || defined(PROTO)
419/*
420 * Prepare encryption for "buf" for the current key and method.
421 */
422 static void
423ml_set_mfp_crypt(buf_T *buf)
424{
425 if (*buf->b_p_key != NUL'\000')
426 {
427 int method_nr = crypt_get_method_nr(buf);
428
429 if (method_nr > CRYPT_M_ZIP0)
430 {
431 // Generate a seed and store it in the memfile.
432 sha2_seed(buf->b_ml.ml_mfp->mf_seed, MF_SEED_LEN8, NULL((void*)0), 0);
433 }
434 }
435}
436
437/*
438 * Prepare encryption for "buf" with block 0 "b0p".
439 */
440 static void
441ml_set_b0_crypt(buf_T *buf, ZERO_BL *b0p)
442{
443 if (*buf->b_p_key == NUL'\000')
444 b0p->b0_id[1] = BLOCK0_ID1'0';
445 else
446 {
447 int method_nr = crypt_get_method_nr(buf);
448
449 b0p->b0_id[1] = id1_codes[method_nr];
450 if (method_nr > CRYPT_M_ZIP0)
451 {
452 // Generate a seed and store it in block 0 and in the memfile.
453 sha2_seed(&b0p->b0_seedb0_fname[900 - 2 - 8], MF_SEED_LEN8, NULL((void*)0), 0);
454 mch_memmove(buf->b_ml.ml_mfp->mf_seed, &b0p->b0_seed, MF_SEED_LEN)memmove((char *)(buf->b_ml.ml_mfp->mf_seed), (char *)(&
b0p->b0_fname[900 - 2 - 8]), 8);
455 }
456 }
457}

459/*
460 * Called after the crypt key or 'cryptmethod' was changed for "buf".
461 * Will apply this to the swapfile.
462 * "old_key" is the previous key. It is equal to buf->b_p_key when
463 * 'cryptmethod' is changed.
464 * "old_cm" is the previous 'cryptmethod'. It is equal to the current
465 * 'cryptmethod' when 'key' is changed.
466 */
467 void
468ml_set_crypt_key(
469 buf_T *buf,
470 char_u *old_key,
471 char_u *old_cm)
472{
473 memfile_T *mfp = buf->b_ml.ml_mfp;
474 bhdr_T *hp;
475 int page_count;
476 int idx;
477 long error;
478 infoptr_T *ip;
479 PTR_BL *pp;
480 DATA_BL *dp;
481 blocknr_T bnum;
482 int top;
483 int old_method;
484
485 if (mfp == NULL((void*)0))
486 return; // no memfile yet, nothing to do
487 old_method = crypt_method_nr_from_name(old_cm);
488
489 // First make sure the swapfile is in a consistent state, using the old
490 // key and method.
491 {
492 char_u *new_key = buf->b_p_key;
493 char_u *new_buf_cm = buf->b_p_cm;
494
495 buf->b_p_key = old_key;
496 buf->b_p_cm = old_cm;
497 ml_preserve(buf, FALSE0);
498 buf->b_p_key = new_key;
499 buf->b_p_cm = new_buf_cm;
500 }
501
502 // Set the key, method and seed to be used for reading, these must be the
503 // old values.
504 mfp->mf_old_key = old_key;
505 mfp->mf_old_cm = old_method;
506 if (old_method > 0 && *old_key != NUL'\000')
507 mch_memmove(mfp->mf_old_seed, mfp->mf_seed, MF_SEED_LEN)memmove((char *)(mfp->mf_old_seed), (char *)(mfp->mf_seed
), 8);
508
509 // Update block 0 with the crypt flag and may set a new seed.
510 ml_upd_block0(buf, UB_CRYPT);
511
512 if (mfp->mf_infile_count > 2)
513 {
514 /*
515 * Need to read back all data blocks from disk, decrypt them with the
516 * old key/method and mark them to be written. The algorithm is
517 * similar to what happens in ml_recover(), but we skip negative block
518 * numbers.
519 */
520 ml_flush_line(buf); // flush buffered line
521 (void)ml_find_line(buf, (linenr_T)0, ML_FLUSH0x02); // flush locked block
522
523 hp = NULL((void*)0);
524 bnum = 1; // start with block 1
525 page_count = 1; // which is 1 page
526 idx = 0; // start with first index in block 1
527 error = 0;
528 buf->b_ml.ml_stack_top = 0;
529 VIM_CLEAR(buf->b_ml.ml_stack)do { if ((buf->b_ml.ml_stack) != ((void*)0)) { vim_free(buf
->b_ml.ml_stack); (buf->b_ml.ml_stack) = ((void*)0); } }
while (0);
530 buf->b_ml.ml_stack_size = 0; // no stack yet
531
532 for ( ; !got_int; line_breakcheck())
533 {
534 if (hp != NULL((void*)0))
535 mf_put(mfp, hp, FALSE0, FALSE0); // release previous block
536
537 // get the block (pointer or data)
538 if ((hp = mf_get(mfp, (blocknr_T)bnum, page_count)) == NULL((void*)0))
539 {
540 if (bnum == 1)
541 break;
542 ++error;
543 }
544 else
545 {
546 pp = (PTR_BL *)(hp->bh_data);
547 if (pp->pb_id == PTR_ID(('p' << 8) + 't')) // it is a pointer block
548 {
549 if (pp->pb_count == 0)
550 {
551 // empty block?
552 ++error;
553 }
554 else if (idx < (int)pp->pb_count) // go a block deeper
555 {
556 if (pp->pb_pointer[idx].pe_bnum < 0)
557 {
558 // Skip data block with negative block number.
559 // Should not happen, because of the ml_preserve()
560 // above. Get same block again for next index.
561 ++idx;
562 continue;
563 }
564
565 // going one block deeper in the tree, new entry in
566 // stack
567 if ((top = ml_add_stack(buf)) < 0)
568 {
569 ++error;
570 break; // out of memory
571 }
572 ip = &(buf->b_ml.ml_stack[top]);
573 ip->ip_bnum = bnum;
574 ip->ip_index = idx;
575
576 bnum = pp->pb_pointer[idx].pe_bnum;
577 page_count = pp->pb_pointer[idx].pe_page_count;
578 idx = 0;
579 continue;
580 }
581 }
582 else // not a pointer block
583 {
584 dp = (DATA_BL *)(hp->bh_data);
585 if (dp->db_id != DATA_ID(('d' << 8) + 'a')) // block id wrong
586 ++error;
587 else
588 {
589 // It is a data block, need to write it back to disk.
590 mf_put(mfp, hp, TRUE1, FALSE0);
591 hp = NULL((void*)0);
592 }
593 }
594 }
595
596 if (buf->b_ml.ml_stack_top == 0) // finished
597 break;
598
599 // go one block up in the tree
600 ip = &(buf->b_ml.ml_stack[--(buf->b_ml.ml_stack_top)]);
601 bnum = ip->ip_bnum;
602 idx = ip->ip_index + 1; // go to next index
603 page_count = 1;
604 }
605 if (hp != NULL((void*)0))
606 mf_put(mfp, hp, FALSE0, FALSE0); // release previous block
607
608 if (error > 0)
609 emsg(_("E843: Error while updating swap file crypt")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E843: Error while updating swap file crypt"
), 5));
610 }
611
612 mfp->mf_old_key = NULL((void*)0);
613}
614#endif
615
616/*
617 * ml_setname() is called when the file name of "buf" has been changed.
618 * It may rename the swap file.
619 */
620 void
621ml_setname(buf_T *buf)
622{
623 int success = FALSE0;
624 memfile_T *mfp;
625 char_u *fname;
626 char_u *dirp;
627#if defined(MSWIN)
628 char_u *p;
629#endif
630
631 mfp = buf->b_ml.ml_mfp;
632 if (mfp->mf_fd < 0) // there is no swap file yet
633 {
634 /*
635 * When 'updatecount' is 0 and 'noswapfile' there is no swap file.
636 * For help files we will make a swap file now.
637 */
638 if (p_uc != 0 && (cmdmod.cmod_flags & CMOD_NOSWAPFILE0x2000) == 0)
639 ml_open_file(buf); // create a swap file
640 return;
641 }
642
643 /*
644 * Try all directories in the 'directory' option.
645 */
646 dirp = p_dir;
647 for (;;)
648 {
649 if (*dirp == NUL'\000') // tried all directories, fail
650 break;
651 fname = findswapname(buf, &dirp, mfp->mf_fname);
652 // alloc's fname
653 if (dirp == NULL((void*)0)) // out of memory
654 break;
655 if (fname == NULL((void*)0)) // no file name found for this dir
656 continue;
657
658#if defined(MSWIN)
659 /*
660 * Set full pathname for swap file now, because a ":!cd dir" may
661 * change directory without us knowing it.
662 */
663 p = FullName_save(fname, FALSE0);
664 vim_free(fname);
665 fname = p;
666 if (fname == NULL((void*)0))
667 continue;
668#endif
669 // if the file name is the same we don't have to do anything
670 if (fnamecmp(fname, mfp->mf_fname)vim_fnamecmp((char_u *)(fname), (char_u *)(mfp->mf_fname)) == 0)
671 {
672 vim_free(fname);
673 success = TRUE1;
674 break;
675 }
676 // need to close the swap file before renaming
677 if (mfp->mf_fd >= 0)
678 {
679 close(mfp->mf_fd);
680 mfp->mf_fd = -1;
681 }
682
683 // try to rename the swap file
684 if (vim_rename(mfp->mf_fname, fname) == 0)
685 {
686 success = TRUE1;
687 vim_free(mfp->mf_fname);
688 mfp->mf_fname = fname;
689 vim_free(mfp->mf_ffname);
690#if defined(MSWIN)
691 mfp->mf_ffname = NULL((void*)0); // mf_fname is full pathname already
692#else
693 mf_set_ffname(mfp);
694#endif
695 ml_upd_block0(buf, UB_SAME_DIR);
696 break;
697 }
698 vim_free(fname); // this fname didn't work, try another
699 }
700
701 if (mfp->mf_fd == -1) // need to (re)open the swap file
702 {
703 mfp->mf_fd = mch_open((char *)mfp->mf_fname, O_RDWR | O_EXTRA, 0)open(((char *)mfp->mf_fname), (02 | 0), (0));
704 if (mfp->mf_fd < 0)
705 {
706 // could not (re)open the swap file, what can we do????
707 emsg(_("E301: Oops, lost the swap file!!!")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E301: Oops, lost the swap file!!!"
), 5));
708 return;
709 }
710#ifdef HAVE_FD_CLOEXEC1
711 {
712 int fdflags = fcntl(mfp->mf_fd, F_GETFD1);
713 if (fdflags >= 0 && (fdflags & FD_CLOEXEC1) == 0)
714 (void)fcntl(mfp->mf_fd, F_SETFD2, fdflags | FD_CLOEXEC1);
715 }
716#endif
717 }
718 if (!success)
719 emsg(_("E302: Could not rename swap file")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E302: Could not rename swap file"
), 5));
720}
721
722/*
723 * Open a file for the memfile for all buffers that are not readonly or have
724 * been modified.
725 * Used when 'updatecount' changes from zero to non-zero.
726 */
727 void
728ml_open_files(void)
729{
730 buf_T *buf;
731
732 FOR_ALL_BUFFERS(buf)for ((buf) = firstbuf; (buf) != ((void*)0); (buf) = (buf)->
b_next)
733 if (!buf->b_p_ro || buf->b_changed)
734 ml_open_file(buf);
735}
736
737/*
738 * Open a swap file for an existing memfile, if there is no swap file yet.
739 * If we are unable to find a file name, mf_fname will be NULL
740 * and the memfile will be in memory only (no recovery possible).
741 */
742 void
743ml_open_file(buf_T *buf)
744{
745 memfile_T *mfp;
746 char_u *fname;
747 char_u *dirp;
748
749 mfp = buf->b_ml.ml_mfp;
750 if (mfp == NULL((void*)0) || mfp->mf_fd >= 0 || !buf->b_p_swf
751 || (cmdmod.cmod_flags & CMOD_NOSWAPFILE0x2000))
752 return; // nothing to do
753
754#ifdef FEAT_SPELL
755 // For a spell buffer use a temp file name.
756 if (buf->b_spell)
757 {
758 fname = vim_tempname('s', FALSE0);
759 if (fname != NULL((void*)0))
760 (void)mf_open_file(mfp, fname); // consumes fname!
761 buf->b_may_swap = FALSE0;
762 return;
763 }
764#endif
765
766 /*
767 * Try all directories in 'directory' option.
768 */
769 dirp = p_dir;
770 for (;;)
771 {
772 if (*dirp == NUL'\000')
773 break;
774 // There is a small chance that between choosing the swap file name
775 // and creating it, another Vim creates the file. In that case the
776 // creation will fail and we will use another directory.
777 fname = findswapname(buf, &dirp, NULL((void*)0)); // allocates fname
778 if (dirp == NULL((void*)0))
779 break; // out of memory
780 if (fname == NULL((void*)0))
781 continue;
782 if (mf_open_file(mfp, fname) == OK1) // consumes fname!
783 {
784#if defined(MSWIN)
785 /*
786 * set full pathname for swap file now, because a ":!cd dir" may
787 * change directory without us knowing it.
788 */
789 mf_fullname(mfp);
790#endif
791 ml_upd_block0(buf, UB_SAME_DIR);
792
793 // Flush block zero, so others can read it
794 if (mf_sync(mfp, MFS_ZERO8) == OK1)
795 {
796 // Mark all blocks that should be in the swapfile as dirty.
797 // Needed for when the 'swapfile' option was reset, so that
798 // the swap file was deleted, and then on again.
799 mf_set_dirty(mfp);
800 break;
801 }
802 // Writing block 0 failed: close the file and try another dir
803 mf_close_file(buf, FALSE0);
804 }
805 }
806
807 if (*p_dir != NUL'\000' && mfp->mf_fname == NULL((void*)0))
808 {
809 need_wait_return = TRUE1; // call wait_return later
810 ++no_wait_return;
811 (void)semsg(_("E303: Unable to open swap file for \"%s\", recovery impossible")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E303: Unable to open swap file for \"%s\", recovery impossible"
), 5),
812 buf_spname(buf) != NULL((void*)0) ? buf_spname(buf) : buf->b_fname);
813 --no_wait_return;
814 }
815
816 // don't try to open a swap file again
817 buf->b_may_swap = FALSE0;
818}
819
820/*
821 * If still need to create a swap file, and starting to edit a not-readonly
822 * file, or reading into an existing buffer, create a swap file now.
823 */
824 void
825check_need_swap(
826 int newfile) // reading file into new buffer
827{
828 int old_msg_silent = msg_silent; // might be reset by an E325 message
829
830 if (curbuf->b_may_swap && (!curbuf->b_p_ro || !newfile))
831 ml_open_file(curbuf);
832 msg_silent = old_msg_silent;
833}

835/*
836 * Close memline for buffer 'buf'.
837 * If 'del_file' is TRUE, delete the swap file
838 */
839 void
840ml_close(buf_T *buf, int del_file)
841{
842 if (buf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL((void*)0)) // not open
843 return;
844 mf_close(buf->b_ml.ml_mfp, del_file); // close the .swp file
845 if (buf->b_ml.ml_line_lnum != 0 && (buf->b_ml.ml_flags & ML_LINE_DIRTY2))
846 vim_free(buf->b_ml.ml_line_ptr);
847 vim_free(buf->b_ml.ml_stack);
848#ifdef FEAT_BYTEOFF
849 VIM_CLEAR(buf->b_ml.ml_chunksize)do { if ((buf->b_ml.ml_chunksize) != ((void*)0)) { vim_free
(buf->b_ml.ml_chunksize); (buf->b_ml.ml_chunksize) = ((
void*)0); } } while (0);
850#endif
851 buf->b_ml.ml_mfp = NULL((void*)0);
852
853 // Reset the "recovered" flag, give the ATTENTION prompt the next time
854 // this buffer is loaded.
855 buf->b_flags &= ~BF_RECOVERED0x01;
856}

858/*
859 * Close all existing memlines and memfiles.
860 * Only used when exiting.
861 * When 'del_file' is TRUE, delete the memfiles.
862 * But don't delete files that were ":preserve"d when we are POSIX compatible.
863 */
864 void
865ml_close_all(int del_file)
866{
867 buf_T *buf;
868
869 FOR_ALL_BUFFERS(buf)for ((buf) = firstbuf; (buf) != ((void*)0); (buf) = (buf)->
b_next)
870 ml_close(buf, del_file && ((buf->b_flags & BF_PRESERVED0x100) == 0
871 || vim_strchr(p_cpo, CPO_PRESERVE'&') == NULL((void*)0)));
872#ifdef FEAT_SPELL
873 spell_delete_wordlist(); // delete the internal wordlist
874#endif
875#ifdef TEMPDIRNAMES"$TMPDIR", "/tmp", ".", "$HOME"
876 vim_deltempdir(); // delete created temp directory
877#endif
878}

880/*
881 * Close all memfiles for not modified buffers.
882 * Only use just before exiting!
883 */
884 void
885ml_close_notmod(void)
886{
887 buf_T *buf;
888
889 FOR_ALL_BUFFERS(buf)for ((buf) = firstbuf; (buf) != ((void*)0); (buf) = (buf)->
b_next)
890 if (!bufIsChanged(buf))
891 ml_close(buf, TRUE1); // close all not-modified buffers
892}

894/*
895 * Update the timestamp in the .swp file.
896 * Used when the file has been written.
897 */
898 void
899ml_timestamp(buf_T *buf)
900{
901 ml_upd_block0(buf, UB_FNAME);
902}

904/*
905 * Return FAIL when the ID of "b0p" is wrong.
906 */
907 static int
908ml_check_b0_id(ZERO_BL *b0p)
909{
910 if (b0p->b0_id[0] != BLOCK0_ID0'b'
911 || (b0p->b0_id[1] != BLOCK0_ID1'0'
912 && b0p->b0_id[1] != BLOCK0_ID1_C0'c'
913 && b0p->b0_id[1] != BLOCK0_ID1_C1'C'
914 && b0p->b0_id[1] != BLOCK0_ID1_C2'd')
915 )
916 return FAIL0;
917 return OK1;
918}
919
920/*
921 * Update the timestamp or the B0_SAME_DIR flag of the .swp file.
922 */
923 static void
924ml_upd_block0(buf_T *buf, upd_block0_T what)
925{
926 memfile_T *mfp;
927 bhdr_T *hp;
928 ZERO_BL *b0p;
929
930 mfp = buf->b_ml.ml_mfp;
931 if (mfp == NULL((void*)0))
932 return;
933 hp = mf_get(mfp, (blocknr_T)0, 1);
934 if (hp == NULL((void*)0))
935 {
936#ifdef FEAT_CRYPT
937 // Possibly update the seed in the memfile before there is a block0.
938 if (what == UB_CRYPT)
939 ml_set_mfp_crypt(buf);
940#endif
941 return;
942 }
943
944 b0p = (ZERO_BL *)(hp->bh_data);
945 if (ml_check_b0_id(b0p) == FAIL0)
946 iemsg(_("E304: ml_upd_block0(): Didn't get block 0??")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E304: ml_upd_block0(): Didn't get block 0??"
), 5));
947 else
948 {
949 if (what == UB_FNAME)
950 set_b0_fname(b0p, buf);
951#ifdef FEAT_CRYPT
952 else if (what == UB_CRYPT)
953 ml_set_b0_crypt(buf, b0p);
954#endif
955 else // what == UB_SAME_DIR
956 set_b0_dir_flag(b0p, buf);
957 }
958 mf_put(mfp, hp, TRUE1, FALSE0);
959}
960
961/*
962 * Write file name and timestamp into block 0 of a swap file.
963 * Also set buf->b_mtime.
964 * Don't use NameBuff[]!!!
965 */
966 static void
967set_b0_fname(ZERO_BL *b0p, buf_T *buf)
968{
969 stat_T st;
970
971 if (buf->b_ffname == NULL((void*)0))
972 b0p->b0_fname[0] = NUL'\000';
973 else
974 {
975#if defined(MSWIN) || defined(AMIGA)
976 // Systems that cannot translate "~user" back into a path: copy the
977 // file name unmodified. Do use slashes instead of backslashes for
978 // portability.
979 vim_strncpy(b0p->b0_fname, buf->b_ffname, B0_FNAME_SIZE_CRYPT890 - 1);
980# ifdef BACKSLASH_IN_FILENAME
981 forward_slash(b0p->b0_fname);
982# endif
983#else
984 size_t flen, ulen;
985 char_u uname[B0_UNAME_SIZE40];
986
987 /*
988 * For a file under the home directory of the current user, we try to
989 * replace the home directory path with "~user". This helps when
990 * editing the same file on different machines over a network.
991 * First replace home dir path with "~/" with home_replace().
992 * Then insert the user name to get "~user/".
993 */
994 home_replace(NULL((void*)0), buf->b_ffname, b0p->b0_fname,
995 B0_FNAME_SIZE_CRYPT890, TRUE1);
996 if (b0p->b0_fname[0] == '~')
997 {
998 flen = STRLEN(b0p->b0_fname)strlen((char *)(b0p->b0_fname));
999 // If there is no user name or it is too long, don't use "~/"
1000 if (get_user_name(uname, B0_UNAME_SIZE40) == FAIL0
1001 || (ulen = STRLEN(uname)strlen((char *)(uname))) + flen > B0_FNAME_SIZE_CRYPT890 - 1)
1002 vim_strncpy(b0p->b0_fname, buf->b_ffname,
1003 B0_FNAME_SIZE_CRYPT890 - 1);
1004 else
1005 {
1006 mch_memmove(b0p->b0_fname + ulen + 1, b0p->b0_fname + 1, flen)memmove((char *)(b0p->b0_fname + ulen + 1), (char *)(b0p->
b0_fname + 1), flen);
1007 mch_memmove(b0p->b0_fname + 1, uname, ulen)memmove((char *)(b0p->b0_fname + 1), (char *)(uname), ulen
);
1008 }
1009 }
1010#endif
1011 if (mch_stat((char *)buf->b_ffname, &st)stat(((char *)buf->b_ffname), (&st)) >= 0)
1012 {
1013 long_to_char((long)st.st_mtimest_mtim.tv_sec, b0p->b0_mtime);
1014#ifdef CHECK_INODE
1015 long_to_char((long)st.st_ino, b0p->b0_ino);
1016#endif
1017 buf_store_time(buf, &st, buf->b_ffname);
1018 buf->b_mtime_read = buf->b_mtime;
1019 }
1020 else
1021 {
1022 long_to_char(0L, b0p->b0_mtime);
1023#ifdef CHECK_INODE
1024 long_to_char(0L, b0p->b0_ino);
1025#endif
1026 buf->b_mtime = 0;
1027 buf->b_mtime_read = 0;
1028 buf->b_orig_size = 0;
1029 buf->b_orig_mode = 0;
1030 }
1031 }
1032
1033 // Also add the 'fileencoding' if there is room.
1034 add_b0_fenc(b0p, curbuf);
1035}
1036
1037/*
1038 * Update the B0_SAME_DIR flag of the swap file. It's set if the file and the
1039 * swapfile for "buf" are in the same directory.
1040 * This is fail safe: if we are not sure the directories are equal the flag is
1041 * not set.
1042 */
1043 static void
1044set_b0_dir_flag(ZERO_BL *b0p, buf_T *buf)
1045{
1046 if (same_directory(buf->b_ml.ml_mfp->mf_fname, buf->b_ffname))
1047 b0p->b0_flagsb0_fname[900 - 2] |= B0_SAME_DIR4;
1048 else
1049 b0p->b0_flagsb0_fname[900 - 2] &= ~B0_SAME_DIR4;
1050}
1051
1052/*
1053 * When there is room, add the 'fileencoding' to block zero.
1054 */
1055 static void
1056add_b0_fenc(
1057 ZERO_BL *b0p,
1058 buf_T *buf)
1059{
1060 int n;
1061 int size = B0_FNAME_SIZE_NOCRYPT898;
1062
1063#ifdef FEAT_CRYPT
1064 // Without encryption use the same offset as in Vim 7.2 to be compatible.
1065 // With encryption it's OK to move elsewhere, the swap file is not
1066 // compatible anyway.
1067 if (*buf->b_p_key != NUL'\000')
1068 size = B0_FNAME_SIZE_CRYPT890;
1069#endif
1070
1071 n = (int)STRLEN(buf->b_p_fenc)strlen((char *)(buf->b_p_fenc));
1072 if ((int)STRLEN(b0p->b0_fname)strlen((char *)(b0p->b0_fname)) + n + 1 > size)
1073 b0p->b0_flagsb0_fname[900 - 2] &= ~B0_HAS_FENC8;
1074 else
1075 {
1076 mch_memmove((char *)b0p->b0_fname + size - n,memmove((char *)((char *)b0p->b0_fname + size - n), (char *
)((char *)buf->b_p_fenc), (size_t)n)
1077 (char *)buf->b_p_fenc, (size_t)n)memmove((char *)((char *)b0p->b0_fname + size - n), (char *
)((char *)buf->b_p_fenc), (size_t)n);
1078 *(b0p->b0_fname + size - n - 1) = NUL'\000';
1079 b0p->b0_flagsb0_fname[900 - 2] |= B0_HAS_FENC8;
1080 }
1081}

1084/*
1085 * Try to recover curbuf from the .swp file.
1086 * If "checkext" is TRUE, check the extension and detect whether it is
1087 * a swap file.
1088 */
1089 void
1090ml_recover(int checkext)
1091{
1092 buf_T *buf = NULL((void*)0);
1093 memfile_T *mfp = NULL((void*)0);
1094 char_u *fname;
1095 char_u *fname_used = NULL((void*)0);
1096 bhdr_T *hp = NULL((void*)0);
1097 ZERO_BL *b0p;
1098 int b0_ff;
1099 char_u *b0_fenc = NULL((void*)0);
1100#ifdef FEAT_CRYPT
1101 int b0_cm = -1;
1102#endif
1103 PTR_BL *pp;
1104 DATA_BL *dp;
1105 infoptr_T *ip;
1106 blocknr_T bnum;
1107 int page_count;
1108 stat_T org_stat, swp_stat;
1109 int len;
1110 int directly;
1111 linenr_T lnum;
1112 char_u *p;
1113 int i;
1114 long error;
1115 int cannot_open;
1116 linenr_T line_count;
1117 int has_error;
1118 int idx;
1119 int top;
1120 int txt_start;
1121 off_T size;
1122 int called_from_main;
1123 int serious_error = TRUE1;
1124 long mtime;
1125 int attr;
1126 int orig_file_status = NOTDONE2;
1127
1128 recoverymode = TRUE1;
1129 called_from_main = (curbuf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL((void*)0));
1130 attr = HL_ATTR(HLF_E)highlight_attr[(int)(HLF_E)];
1131
1132 /*
1133 * If the file name ends in ".s[a-w][a-z]" we assume this is the swap file.
1134 * Otherwise a search is done to find the swap file(s).
1135 */
1136 fname = curbuf->b_fname;
1137 if (fname == NULL((void*)0)) // When there is no file name
1138 fname = (char_u *)"";
1139 len = (int)STRLEN(fname)strlen((char *)(fname));
1140 if (checkext && len >= 4 &&
1141#if defined(VMS)
1142 STRNICMP(fname + len - 4, "_s", 2)strncasecmp((char *)(fname + len - 4), (char *)("_s"), (size_t
)(2))
1143#else
1144 STRNICMP(fname + len - 4, ".s", 2)strncasecmp((char *)(fname + len - 4), (char *)(".s"), (size_t
)(2))
1145#endif
1146 == 0

1577 has_error = TRUE1;

1591 (colnr_T)0, TRUE1);

1593 has_error = TRUE1;
1594 }

1599 if (txt_start <= (int)HEADER_SIZE(sizeof(DATA_BL) - (sizeof(unsigned)))
1600 || txt_start >= (int)dp->db_txt_end)
1601 {
1602 p = (char_u *)"???";
1603 ++error;
1604 }
1605 else

1607 ml_append(lnum++, p, (colnr_T)0, TRUE1);
1608 }

1613 }

1621 */

1628 /*
1629 * Compare the buffer contents with the original file. When they differ
1630 * set the 'modified' flag.
1631 * Lines 1 - lnum are the new contents.
1632 * Lines lnum + 1 to ml_line_count are the original contents.
1633 * Line ml_line_count + 1 in the dummy empty line.
1634 */

1638 // empty. Don't set the modified flag then.

1643 }
1644 }
1645 else
1646 {
1647 for (idx = 1; idx <= lnum; ++idx)
1648 {
1649 // Need to copy one line, fetching the other one may flush it.
1650 p = vim_strsave(ml_get(idx));
1651 i = STRCMP(p, ml_get(idx + lnum))strcmp((char *)(p), (char *)(ml_get(idx + lnum)));
1652 vim_free(p);
1653 if (i != 0)
1654 {
1655 changed_internal();
1656 ++CHANGEDTICK(curbuf)((curbuf)->b_ct_di.di_tv.vval.v_number);
1657 break;
1658 }
1659 }
1660 }
1661
1662 /*
1663 * Delete the lines from the original file and the dummy line from the
1664 * empty buffer. These will now be after the last line in the buffer.
1665 */
1666 while (curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count > lnum
1667 && !(curbuf->b_ml.ml_flags & ML_EMPTY1))
1668 ml_delete(curbuf->b_ml.ml_line_count);
1669 curbuf->b_flags |= BF_RECOVERED0x01;
1670
1671 recoverymode = FALSE0;
1672 if (got_int)
1673 emsg(_("E311: Recovery Interrupted")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E311: Recovery Interrupted")
, 5));
1674 else if (error)
1675 {
1676 ++no_wait_return;
1677 msg(">>>>>>>>>>>>>");
1678 emsg(_("E312: Errors detected while recovering; look for lines starting with ???")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E312: Errors detected while recovering; look for lines starting with ???"
), 5));
1679 --no_wait_return;
1680 msg(_("See \":help E312\" for more information.")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("See \":help E312\" for more information."
), 5));
1681 msg(">>>>>>>>>>>>>");
1682 }
1683 else
1684 {
1685 if (curbuf->b_changed)
1686 {
1687 msg(_("Recovery completed. You should check if everything is OK.")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("Recovery completed. You should check if everything is OK."
), 5));
1688 msg_puts(_("\n(You might want to write out this file under another name\n")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("\n(You might want to write out this file under another name\n"
), 5));
1689 msg_puts(_("and run diff with the original file to check for changes)")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("and run diff with the original file to check for changes)"
), 5));
1690 }
1691 else
1692 msg(_("Recovery completed. Buffer contents equals file contents.")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("Recovery completed. Buffer contents equals file contents."
), 5));
1693 msg_puts(_("\nYou may want to delete the .swp file now.")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("\nYou may want to delete the .swp file now."
), 5));
1694#if defined(UNIX1) || defined(MSWIN)
1695 if (mch_process_running(char_to_long(b0p->b0_pid)))
1696 {
1697 // Warn there could be an active Vim on the same file, the user may
1698 // want to kill it.
1699 msg_puts(_("\nNote: process STILL RUNNING: ")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("\nNote: process STILL RUNNING: "
), 5));
1700 msg_outnum(char_to_long(b0p->b0_pid));
1701 }
1702#endif
1703 msg_puts("\n\n");
1704 cmdline_row = msg_row;
1705 }
1706#ifdef FEAT_CRYPT
1707 if (*buf->b_p_key != NUL'\000' && STRCMP(curbuf->b_p_key, buf->b_p_key)strcmp((char *)(curbuf->b_p_key), (char *)(buf->b_p_key
)) != 0)
1708 {
1709 msg_puts(_("Using crypt key from swap file for the text file.\n")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("Using crypt key from swap file for the text file.\n"
), 5));
1710 set_option_value((char_u *)"key", 0L, buf->b_p_key, OPT_LOCAL0x04);
1711 }
1712#endif
1713 redraw_curbuf_later(NOT_VALID40);
1714
1715theend:
1716 vim_free(fname_used);
1717 recoverymode = FALSE0;
1718 if (mfp != NULL((void*)0))
1719 {
1720 if (hp != NULL((void*)0))
1721 mf_put(mfp, hp, FALSE0, FALSE0);
1722 mf_close(mfp, FALSE0); // will also vim_free(mfp->mf_fname)
1723 }
1724 if (buf != NULL((void*)0))
1725 {
1726#ifdef FEAT_CRYPT
1727 if (buf->b_p_key != curbuf->b_p_key)
1728 free_string_option(buf->b_p_key);
1729 free_string_option(buf->b_p_cm);
1730#endif
1731 vim_free(buf->b_ml.ml_stack);
1732 vim_free(buf);
1733 }
1734 if (serious_error && called_from_main)
1735 ml_close(curbuf, TRUE1);
1736 else
1737 {
1738 apply_autocmds(EVENT_BUFREADPOST, NULL((void*)0), curbuf->b_fname, FALSE0, curbuf);
1739 apply_autocmds(EVENT_BUFWINENTER, NULL((void*)0), curbuf->b_fname, FALSE0, curbuf);
1740 }
1741 return;
1742}
1743
1744/*
1745 * Find the names of swap files in current directory and the directory given
1746 * with the 'directory' option.
1747 *
1748 * Used to:
1749 * - list the swap files for "vim -r"
1750 * - count the number of swap files when recovering
1751 * - list the swap files when recovering
1752 * - find the name of the n'th swap file when recovering
1753 */
1754 int
1755recover_names(
1756 char_u *fname, // base for swap file name
1757 int list, // when TRUE, list the swap file names
1758 int nr, // when non-zero, return nr'th swap file name
1759 char_u **fname_out) // result when "nr" > 0
1760{
1761 int num_names;
1762 char_u *(names[6]);
1763 char_u *tail;
1764 char_u *p;
1765 int num_files;
1766 int file_count = 0;
1767 char_u **files;
1768 int i;
1769 char_u *dirp;
1770 char_u *dir_name;
1771 char_u *fname_res = NULL((void*)0);
1772#ifdef HAVE_READLINK1
1773 char_u fname_buf[MAXPATHL4096];
1774#endif
1775
1776 if (fname != NULL((void*)0))
1777 {
1778#ifdef HAVE_READLINK1
1779 // Expand symlink in the file name, because the swap file is created
1780 // with the actual file instead of with the symlink.
1781 if (resolve_symlink(fname, fname_buf) == OK1)
1782 fname_res = fname_buf;
1783 else
1784#endif
1785 fname_res = fname;
1786 }
1787
1788 if (list)
1789 {
1790 // use msg() to start the scrolling properly
1791 msg(_("Swap files found:")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("Swap files found:"), 5));
1792 msg_putchar('\n');
1793 }
1794
1795 /*
1796 * Do the loop for every directory in 'directory'.
1797 * First allocate some memory to put the directory name in.
1798 */
1799 dir_name = alloc(STRLEN(p_dir)strlen((char *)(p_dir)) + 1);
1800 dirp = p_dir;
1801 while (dir_name != NULL((void*)0) && *dirp)
1802 {
1803 /*
1804 * Isolate a directory name from *dirp and put it in dir_name (we know
1805 * it is large enough, so use 31000 for length).
1806 * Advance dirp to next directory name.
1807 */
1808 (void)copy_option_part(&dirp, dir_name, 31000, ",");
1809
1810 if (dir_name[0] == '.' && dir_name[1] == NUL'\000') // check current dir
1811 {
1812 if (fname == NULL((void*)0))
1813 {
1814#ifdef VMS
1815 names[0] = vim_strsave((char_u *)"*_sw%");
1816#else
1817 names[0] = vim_strsave((char_u *)"*.sw?");
1818#endif
1819#if defined(UNIX1) || defined(MSWIN)
1820 // For Unix names starting with a dot are special. MS-Windows
1821 // supports this too, on some file systems.
1822 names[1] = vim_strsave((char_u *)".*.sw?");
1823 names[2] = vim_strsave((char_u *)".sw?");
1824 num_names = 3;
1825#else
1826# ifdef VMS
1827 names[1] = vim_strsave((char_u *)".*_sw%");
1828 num_names = 2;
1829# else
1830 num_names = 1;
1831# endif
1832#endif
1833 }
1834 else
1835 num_names = recov_file_names(names, fname_res, TRUE1);
1836 }
1837 else // check directory dir_name
1838 {
1839 if (fname == NULL((void*)0))
1840 {
1841#ifdef VMS
1842 names[0] = concat_fnames(dir_name, (char_u *)"*_sw%", TRUE1);
1843#else
1844 names[0] = concat_fnames(dir_name, (char_u *)"*.sw?", TRUE1);
1845#endif
1846#if defined(UNIX1) || defined(MSWIN)
1847 // For Unix names starting with a dot are special. MS-Windows
1848 // supports this too, on some file systems.
1849 names[1] = concat_fnames(dir_name, (char_u *)".*.sw?", TRUE1);
1850 names[2] = concat_fnames(dir_name, (char_u *)".sw?", TRUE1);
1851 num_names = 3;
1852#else
1853# ifdef VMS
1854 names[1] = concat_fnames(dir_name, (char_u *)".*_sw%", TRUE1);
1855 num_names = 2;
1856# else
1857 num_names = 1;
1858# endif
1859#endif
1860 }
1861 else
1862 {
1863#if defined(UNIX1) || defined(MSWIN)
1864 int len = (int)STRLEN(dir_name)strlen((char *)(dir_name));
1865
1866 p = dir_name + len;
1867 if (after_pathsep(dir_name, p) && len > 1 && p[-1] == p[-2])
1868 {
1869 // Ends with '//', Use Full path for swap name
1870 tail = make_percent_swname(dir_name, fname_res);
1871 }
1872 else
1873#endif
1874 {
1875 tail = gettail(fname_res);
1876 tail = concat_fnames(dir_name, tail, TRUE1);
1877 }
1878 if (tail == NULL((void*)0))
1879 num_names = 0;
1880 else
1881 {
1882 num_names = recov_file_names(names, tail, FALSE0);
1883 vim_free(tail);
1884 }
1885 }
1886 }
1887
1888 // check for out-of-memory
1889 for (i = 0; i < num_names; ++i)
1890 {
1891 if (names[i] == NULL((void*)0))
1892 {
1893 for (i = 0; i < num_names; ++i)
1894 vim_free(names[i]);
1895 num_names = 0;
1896 }
1897 }
1898 if (num_names == 0)
1899 num_files = 0;
1900 else if (expand_wildcards(num_names, names, &num_files, &files,
1901 EW_NOTENV0x10000|EW_KEEPALL0x10|EW_FILE0x02|EW_SILENT0x20) == FAIL0)
1902 num_files = 0;
1903
1904 /*
1905 * When no swap file found, wildcard expansion might have failed (e.g.
1906 * not able to execute the shell).
1907 * Try finding a swap file by simply adding ".swp" to the file name.
1908 */
1909 if (*dirp == NUL'\000' && file_count + num_files == 0 && fname != NULL((void*)0))
1910 {
1911 stat_T st;
1912 char_u *swapname;
1913
1914 swapname = modname(fname_res,
1915#if defined(VMS)
1916 (char_u *)"_swp", FALSE0
1917#else
1918 (char_u *)".swp", TRUE1
1919#endif
1920 );
1921 if (swapname != NULL((void*)0))
1922 {
1923 if (mch_stat((char *)swapname, &st)stat(((char *)swapname), (&st)) != -1) // It exists!
1924 {
1925 files = ALLOC_ONE(char_u *)(char_u * *)alloc(sizeof(char_u *));
1926 if (files != NULL((void*)0))
1927 {
1928 files[0] = swapname;
1929 swapname = NULL((void*)0);
1930 num_files = 1;
1931 }
1932 }
1933 vim_free(swapname);
1934 }
1935 }
1936
1937 /*
1938 * remove swapfile name of the current buffer, it must be ignored
1939 */
1940 if (curbuf->b_ml.ml_mfp != NULL((void*)0)
1941 && (p = curbuf->b_ml.ml_mfp->mf_fname) != NULL((void*)0))
1942 {
1943 for (i = 0; i < num_files; ++i)
1944 // Do not expand wildcards, on windows would try to expand
1945 // "%tmp%" in "%tmp%file".
1946 if (fullpathcmp(p, files[i], TRUE1, FALSE0) & FPC_SAME1)
1947 {
1948 // Remove the name from files[i]. Move further entries
1949 // down. When the array becomes empty free it here, since
1950 // FreeWild() won't be called below.
1951 vim_free(files[i]);
1952 if (--num_files == 0)
1953 vim_free(files);
1954 else
1955 for ( ; i < num_files; ++i)
1956 files[i] = files[i + 1];
1957 }
1958 }
1959 if (nr > 0)
1960 {
1961 file_count += num_files;
1962 if (nr <= file_count)
1963 {
1964 *fname_out = vim_strsave(
1965 files[nr - 1 + num_files - file_count]);
1966 dirp = (char_u *)""; // stop searching
1967 }
1968 }
1969 else if (list)
1970 {
1971 if (dir_name[0] == '.' && dir_name[1] == NUL'\000')
1972 {
1973 if (fname == NULL((void*)0))
1974 msg_puts(_(" In current directory:\n")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(" In current directory:\n")
, 5));
1975 else
1976 msg_puts(_(" Using specified name:\n")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(" Using specified name:\n")
, 5));
1977 }
1978 else
1979 {
1980 msg_puts(_(" In directory ")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(" In directory "), 5));
1981 msg_home_replace(dir_name);
1982 msg_puts(":\n");
1983 }
1984
1985 if (num_files)
1986 {
1987 for (i = 0; i < num_files; ++i)
1988 {
1989 // print the swap file name
1990 msg_outnum((long)++file_count);
1991 msg_puts(". ");
1992 msg_puts((char *)gettail(files[i]));
1993 msg_putchar('\n');
1994 (void)swapfile_info(files[i]);
1995 }
1996 }
1997 else
1998 msg_puts(_(" -- none --\n")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(" -- none --\n"), 5));
1999 out_flush();
2000 }
2001 else
2002 file_count += num_files;
2003
2004 for (i = 0; i < num_names; ++i)
2005 vim_free(names[i]);
2006 if (num_files > 0)
2007 FreeWild(num_files, files);
2008 }
2009 vim_free(dir_name);
2010 return file_count;
2011}

2013#if defined(UNIX1) || defined(MSWIN) || defined(PROTO)
2014/*
2015 * Need _very_ long file names.
2016 * Append the full path to name with path separators made into percent
2017 * signs, to dir. An unnamed buffer is handled as "" (<currentdir>/"")
2018 */
2019 char_u *
2020make_percent_swname(char_u *dir, char_u *name)
2021{
2022 char_u *d = NULL((void*)0), *s, *f;
2023
2024 f = fix_fname(name != NULL((void*)0) ? name : (char_u *)"");
2025 if (f != NULL((void*)0))
2026 {
2027 s = alloc(STRLEN(f)strlen((char *)(f)) + 1);
2028 if (s != NULL((void*)0))
2029 {
2030 STRCPY(s, f)strcpy((char *)(s), (char *)(f));
2031 for (d = s; *d != NUL'\000'; MB_PTR_ADV(d)d += (*mb_ptr2len)(d))
2032 if (vim_ispathsep(*d))
2033 *d = '%';
2034 d = concat_fnames(dir, s, TRUE1);
2035 vim_free(s);
2036 }
2037 vim_free(f);
2038 }
2039 return d;
2040}

2049#if defined(FEAT_EVAL) || defined(PROTO)
2050/*
2051 * Return information found in swapfile "fname" in dictionary "d".
2052 * This is used by the swapinfo() function.
2053 */
2054 void
2055get_b0_dict(char_u *fname, dict_T *d)
2056{
2057 int fd;
2058 struct block0 b0;
2059
2060 if ((fd = mch_open((char *)fname, O_RDONLY | O_EXTRA, 0)open(((char *)fname), (00 | 0), (0))) >= 0)
2061 {
2062 if (read_eintr(fd, &b0, sizeof(b0)) == sizeof(b0))
2063 {
2064 if (ml_check_b0_id(&b0) == FAIL0)
2065 dict_add_string(d, "error", (char_u *)"Not a swap file");
2066 else if (b0_magic_wrong(&b0))
2067 dict_add_string(d, "error", (char_u *)"Magic number mismatch");
2068 else
2069 {
2070 // we have swap information
2071 dict_add_string_len(d, "version", b0.b0_version, 10);
2072 dict_add_string_len(d, "user", b0.b0_uname, B0_UNAME_SIZE40);
2073 dict_add_string_len(d, "host", b0.b0_hname, B0_HNAME_SIZE40);
2074 dict_add_string_len(d, "fname", b0.b0_fname, B0_FNAME_SIZE_ORG900);
2075
2076 dict_add_number(d, "pid", char_to_long(b0.b0_pid));
2077 dict_add_number(d, "mtime", char_to_long(b0.b0_mtime));
2078 dict_add_number(d, "dirty", b0.b0_dirtyb0_fname[900 - 1] ? 1 : 0);
2079# ifdef CHECK_INODE
2080 dict_add_number(d, "inode", char_to_long(b0.b0_ino));
2081# endif
2082 }
2083 }
2084 else
2085 dict_add_string(d, "error", (char_u *)"Cannot read file");
2086 close(fd);
2087 }
2088 else
2089 dict_add_string(d, "error", (char_u *)"Cannot open file");
2090}
2091#endif

2093/*
2094 * Give information about an existing swap file.
2095 * Returns timestamp (0 when unknown).
2096 */
2097 static time_t
2098swapfile_info(char_u *fname)
2099{
2100 stat_T st;
2101 int fd;
2102 struct block0 b0;
2103#ifdef UNIX1
2104 char_u uname[B0_UNAME_SIZE40];
2105#endif
2106
2107 // print the swap file date
2108 if (mch_stat((char *)fname, &st)stat(((char *)fname), (&st)) != -1)
2109 {
2110#ifdef UNIX1
2111 // print name of owner of the file
2112 if (mch_get_uname(st.st_uid, uname, B0_UNAME_SIZE40) == OK1)
2113 {
2114 msg_puts(_(" owned by: ")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(" owned by: "), 5));
2115 msg_outtrans(uname);
2116 msg_puts(_(" dated: ")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(" dated: "), 5));
2117 }
2118 else
2119#endif
2120 msg_puts(_(" dated: ")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(" dated: "), 5));
2121 msg_puts(get_ctime(st.st_mtimest_mtim.tv_sec, TRUE1));
2122 }
2123 else
2124 st.st_mtimest_mtim.tv_sec = 0;
2125
2126 /*
2127 * print the original file name
2128 */
2129 fd = mch_open((char *)fname, O_RDONLY | O_EXTRA, 0)open(((char *)fname), (00 | 0), (0));
2130 if (fd >= 0)
2131 {
2132 if (read_eintr(fd, &b0, sizeof(b0)) == sizeof(b0))
2133 {
2134 if (STRNCMP(b0.b0_version, "VIM 3.0", 7)strncmp((char *)(b0.b0_version), (char *)("VIM 3.0"), (size_t
)(7)) == 0)
2135 {
2136 msg_puts(_(" [from Vim version 3.0]")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(" [from Vim version 3.0]"
), 5));
2137 }
2138 else if (ml_check_b0_id(&b0) == FAIL0)
2139 {
2140 msg_puts(_(" [does not look like a Vim swap file]")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(" [does not look like a Vim swap file]"
), 5));
2141 }
2142 else
2143 {
2144 msg_puts(_(" file name: ")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(" file name: "), 5));
2145 if (b0.b0_fname[0] == NUL'\000')
2146 msg_puts(_("[No Name]")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("[No Name]"), 5));
2147 else
2148 msg_outtrans(b0.b0_fname);
2149
2150 msg_puts(_("\n modified: ")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("\n modified: "), 5));
2151 msg_puts(b0.b0_dirtyb0_fname[900 - 1] ? _("YES")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("YES"), 5) : _("no")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("no"), 5));
2152
2153 if (*(b0.b0_uname) != NUL'\000')
2154 {
2155 msg_puts(_("\n user name: ")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("\n user name: "), 5));
2156 msg_outtrans(b0.b0_uname);
2157 }
2158
2159 if (*(b0.b0_hname) != NUL'\000')
2160 {
2161 if (*(b0.b0_uname) != NUL'\000')
2162 msg_puts(_(" host name: ")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(" host name: "), 5));
2163 else
2164 msg_puts(_("\n host name: ")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("\n host name: "), 5));
2165 msg_outtrans(b0.b0_hname);
2166 }
2167
2168 if (char_to_long(b0.b0_pid) != 0L)
2169 {
2170 msg_puts(_("\n process ID: ")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("\n process ID: "), 5));
2171 msg_outnum(char_to_long(b0.b0_pid));
2172#if defined(UNIX1) || defined(MSWIN)
2173 if (mch_process_running(char_to_long(b0.b0_pid)))
2174 {
2175 msg_puts(_(" (STILL RUNNING)")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(" (STILL RUNNING)"), 5));
2176# ifdef HAVE_PROCESS_STILL_RUNNING
2177 process_still_running = TRUE1;
2178# endif
2179 }
2180#endif
2181 }
2182
2183 if (b0_magic_wrong(&b0))
2184 {
2185#if defined(MSWIN)
2186 if (STRNCMP(b0.b0_hname, "PC ", 3)strncmp((char *)(b0.b0_hname), (char *)("PC "), (size_t)(3)) == 0)
2187 msg_puts(_("\n [not usable with this version of Vim]")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("\n [not usable with this version of Vim]"
), 5));
2188 else
2189#endif
2190 msg_puts(_("\n [not usable on this computer]")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("\n [not usable on this computer]"
), 5));
2191 }
2192 }
2193 }
2194 else
2195 msg_puts(_(" [cannot be read]")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(" [cannot be read]"),
5));
2196 close(fd);
2197 }
2198 else
2199 msg_puts(_(" [cannot be opened]")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)(" [cannot be opened]"
), 5));
2200 msg_putchar('\n');
2201
2202 return st.st_mtimest_mtim.tv_sec;
2203}
2204
2205/*
2206 * Return TRUE if the swap file looks OK and there are no changes, thus it can
2207 * be safely deleted.
2208 */
2209 static time_t
2210swapfile_unchanged(char_u *fname)
2211{
2212 stat_T st;
2213 int fd;
2214 struct block0 b0;
2215 int ret = TRUE1;
2216#if defined(UNIX1) || defined(MSWIN)
2217 long pid;
2218#endif
2219
2220 // must be able to stat the swap file
2221 if (mch_stat((char *)fname, &st)stat(((char *)fname), (&st)) == -1)
2222 return FALSE0;
2223
2224 // must be able to read the first block
2225 fd = mch_open((char *)fname, O_RDONLY | O_EXTRA, 0)open(((char *)fname), (00 | 0), (0));
2226 if (fd < 0)
2227 return FALSE0;
2228 if (read_eintr(fd, &b0, sizeof(b0)) != sizeof(b0))
2229 {
2230 close(fd);
2231 return FALSE0;
2232 }
2233
2234 // the ID and magic number must be correct
2235 if (ml_check_b0_id(&b0) == FAIL0|| b0_magic_wrong(&b0))
2236 ret = FALSE0;
2237
2238 // must be unchanged
2239 if (b0.b0_dirtyb0_fname[900 - 1])
2240 ret = FALSE0;
2241
2242#if defined(UNIX1) || defined(MSWIN)
2243 // Host name must be known and must equal the current host name, otherwise
2244 // comparing pid is meaningless.
2245 if (*(b0.b0_hname) == NUL'\000')
2246 {
2247 ret = FALSE0;
2248 }
2249 else
2250 {
2251 char_u hostname[B0_HNAME_SIZE40];
2252
2253 mch_get_host_name(hostname, B0_HNAME_SIZE40);
2254 hostname[B0_HNAME_SIZE40 - 1] = NUL'\000';
2255 b0.b0_hname[B0_HNAME_SIZE40 - 1] = NUL'\000'; // in case of corruption
2256 if (STRICMP(b0.b0_hname, hostname)strcasecmp((char *)(b0.b0_hname), (char *)(hostname)) != 0)
2257 ret = FALSE0;
2258 }
2259
2260 // process must be known and not be running
2261 pid = char_to_long(b0.b0_pid);
2262 if (pid == 0L || mch_process_running(pid))
2263 ret = FALSE0;
2264#endif
2265
2266 // We do not check the user, it should be irrelevant for whether the swap
2267 // file is still useful.
2268
2269 close(fd);
2270 return ret;
2271}
2272
2273 static int
2274recov_file_names(char_u **names, char_u *path, int prepend_dot)
2275{
2276 int num_names;
2277
2278 /*
2279 * (Win32 and Win64) never short names, but do prepend a dot.
2280 * (Not MS-DOS or Win32 or Win64) maybe short name, maybe not: Try both.
2281 * Only use the short name if it is different.
2282 */
2283 char_u *p;
2284 int i;
2285# ifndef MSWIN
2286 int shortname = curbuf->b_shortname;
2287
2288 curbuf->b_shortname = FALSE0;
2289# endif
2290
2291 num_names = 0;
2292
2293 /*
2294 * May also add the file name with a dot prepended, for swap file in same
2295 * dir as original file.
2296 */
2297 if (prepend_dot)
2298 {
2299 names[num_names] = modname(path, (char_u *)".sw?", TRUE1);
2300 if (names[num_names] == NULL((void*)0))
2301 goto end;
2302 ++num_names;
2303 }
2304
2305 /*
2306 * Form the normal swap file name pattern by appending ".sw?".
2307 */
2308#ifdef VMS
2309 names[num_names] = concat_fnames(path, (char_u *)"_sw%", FALSE0);
2310#else
2311 names[num_names] = concat_fnames(path, (char_u *)".sw?", FALSE0);
2312#endif
2313 if (names[num_names] == NULL((void*)0))
2314 goto end;
2315 if (num_names >= 1) // check if we have the same name twice
2316 {
2317 p = names[num_names - 1];
2318 i = (int)STRLEN(names[num_names - 1])strlen((char *)(names[num_names - 1])) - (int)STRLEN(names[num_names])strlen((char *)(names[num_names]));
2319 if (i > 0)
2320 p += i; // file name has been expanded to full path
2321
2322 if (STRCMP(p, names[num_names])strcmp((char *)(p), (char *)(names[num_names])) != 0)
2323 ++num_names;
2324 else
2325 vim_free(names[num_names]);
2326 }
2327 else
2328 ++num_names;
2329
2330# ifndef MSWIN
2331 /*
2332 * Also try with 'shortname' set, in case the file is on a DOS filesystem.
2333 */
2334 curbuf->b_shortname = TRUE1;
2335#ifdef VMS
2336 names[num_names] = modname(path, (char_u *)"_sw%", FALSE0);
2337#else
2338 names[num_names] = modname(path, (char_u *)".sw?", FALSE0);
2339#endif
2340 if (names[num_names] == NULL((void*)0))
2341 goto end;
2342
2343 /*
2344 * Remove the one from 'shortname', if it's the same as with 'noshortname'.
2345 */
2346 p = names[num_names];
2347 i = STRLEN(names[num_names])strlen((char *)(names[num_names])) - STRLEN(names[num_names - 1])strlen((char *)(names[num_names - 1]));
2348 if (i > 0)
2349 p += i; // file name has been expanded to full path
2350 if (STRCMP(names[num_names - 1], p)strcmp((char *)(names[num_names - 1]), (char *)(p)) == 0)
2351 vim_free(names[num_names]);
2352 else
2353 ++num_names;
2354# endif
2355
2356end:
2357# ifndef MSWIN
2358 curbuf->b_shortname = shortname;
2359# endif
2360
2361 return num_names;
2362}
2363
2364/*
2365 * sync all memlines
2366 *
2367 * If 'check_file' is TRUE, check if original file exists and was not changed.
2368 * If 'check_char' is TRUE, stop syncing when character becomes available, but
2369 * always sync at least one block.
2370 */
2371 void
2372ml_sync_all(int check_file, int check_char)
2373{
2374 buf_T *buf;
2375 stat_T st;
2376
2377 FOR_ALL_BUFFERS(buf)for ((buf) = firstbuf; (buf) != ((void*)0); (buf) = (buf)->
b_next)
2378 {
2379 if (buf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL((void*)0) || buf->b_ml.ml_mfp->mf_fname == NULL((void*)0))
2380 continue; // no file
2381
2382 ml_flush_line(buf); // flush buffered line
2383 // flush locked block
2384 (void)ml_find_line(buf, (linenr_T)0, ML_FLUSH0x02);
2385 if (bufIsChanged(buf) && check_file && mf_need_trans(buf->b_ml.ml_mfp)
2386 && buf->b_ffname != NULL((void*)0))
2387 {
2388 /*
2389 * If the original file does not exist anymore or has been changed
2390 * call ml_preserve() to get rid of all negative numbered blocks.
2391 */
2392 if (mch_stat((char *)buf->b_ffname, &st)stat(((char *)buf->b_ffname), (&st)) == -1
2393 || st.st_mtimest_mtim.tv_sec != buf->b_mtime_read
2394 || st.st_size != buf->b_orig_size)
2395 {
2396 ml_preserve(buf, FALSE0);
2397 did_check_timestamps = FALSE0;
2398 need_check_timestamps = TRUE1; // give message later
2399 }
2400 }
2401 if (buf->b_ml.ml_mfp->mf_dirty)
2402 {
2403 (void)mf_sync(buf->b_ml.ml_mfp, (check_char ? MFS_STOP2 : 0)
2404 | (bufIsChanged(buf) ? MFS_FLUSH4 : 0));
2405 if (check_char && ui_char_avail()) // character available now
2406 break;
2407 }
2408 }
2409}
2410
2411/*
2412 * sync one buffer, including negative blocks
2413 *
2414 * after this all the blocks are in the swap file
2415 *
2416 * Used for the :preserve command and when the original file has been
2417 * changed or deleted.
2418 *
2419 * when message is TRUE the success of preserving is reported
2420 */
2421 void
2422ml_preserve(buf_T *buf, int message)
2423{
2424 bhdr_T *hp;
2425 linenr_T lnum;
2426 memfile_T *mfp = buf->b_ml.ml_mfp;
2427 int status;
2428 int got_int_save = got_int;
2429
2430 if (mfp == NULL((void*)0) || mfp->mf_fname == NULL((void*)0))
2431 {
2432 if (message)
2433 emsg(_("E313: Cannot preserve, there is no swap file")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E313: Cannot preserve, there is no swap file"
), 5));
2434 return;
2435 }
2436
2437 // We only want to stop when interrupted here, not when interrupted
2438 // before.
2439 got_int = FALSE0;
2440
2441 ml_flush_line(buf); // flush buffered line
2442 (void)ml_find_line(buf, (linenr_T)0, ML_FLUSH0x02); // flush locked block
2443 status = mf_sync(mfp, MFS_ALL1 | MFS_FLUSH4);
2444
2445 // stack is invalid after mf_sync(.., MFS_ALL)
2446 buf->b_ml.ml_stack_top = 0;
2447
2448 /*
2449 * Some of the data blocks may have been changed from negative to
2450 * positive block number. In that case the pointer blocks need to be
2451 * updated.
2452 *
2453 * We don't know in which pointer block the references are, so we visit
2454 * all data blocks until there are no more translations to be done (or
2455 * we hit the end of the file, which can only happen in case a write fails,
2456 * e.g. when file system if full).
2457 * ml_find_line() does the work by translating the negative block numbers
2458 * when getting the first line of each data block.
2459 */
2460 if (mf_need_trans(mfp) && !got_int)
2461 {
2462 lnum = 1;
2463 while (mf_need_trans(mfp) && lnum <= buf->b_ml.ml_line_count)
2464 {
2465 hp = ml_find_line(buf, lnum, ML_FIND0x13);
2466 if (hp == NULL((void*)0))
2467 {
2468 status = FAIL0;
2469 goto theend;
2470 }
2471 CHECK(buf->b_ml.ml_locked_low != lnum, "low != lnum")do { } while (0);
2472 lnum = buf->b_ml.ml_locked_high + 1;
2473 }
2474 (void)ml_find_line(buf, (linenr_T)0, ML_FLUSH0x02); // flush locked block
2475 // sync the updated pointer blocks
2476 if (mf_sync(mfp, MFS_ALL1 | MFS_FLUSH4) == FAIL0)
2477 status = FAIL0;
2478 buf->b_ml.ml_stack_top = 0; // stack is invalid now
2479 }
2480theend:
2481 got_int |= got_int_save;
2482
2483 if (message)
2484 {
2485 if (status == OK1)
2486 msg(_("File preserved")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("File preserved"), 5));
2487 else
2488 emsg(_("E314: Preserve failed")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E314: Preserve failed"), 5));
2489 }
2490}
2491
2492/*
2493 * NOTE: The pointer returned by the ml_get_*() functions only remains valid
2494 * until the next call!
2495 * line1 = ml_get(1);
2496 * line2 = ml_get(2); // line1 is now invalid!
2497 * Make a copy of the line if necessary.
2498 */
2499/*
2500 * Return a pointer to a (read-only copy of a) line.
2501 *
2502 * On failure an error message is given and IObuff is returned (to avoid
2503 * having to check for error everywhere).
2504 */
2505 char_u *
2506ml_get(linenr_T lnum)
2507{
2508 return ml_get_buf(curbuf, lnum, FALSE0);
2509}
2510
2511/*
2512 * Return pointer to position "pos".
2513 */
2514 char_u *
2515ml_get_pos(pos_T *pos)
2516{
2517 return (ml_get_buf(curbuf, pos->lnum, FALSE0) + pos->col);
2518}

2521 * Return pointer to cursor line.
2522 */
2523 char_u *
2524ml_get_curline(void)
2525{
2526 return ml_get_buf(curbuf, curwin->w_cursor.lnum, FALSE0);
2527}
2528
2529/*
2530 * Return pointer to cursor position.
2531 */
2532 char_u *
2533ml_get_cursor(void)

2536 curwin->w_cursor.col);
2537}
2538
2539/*
2540 * Return a pointer to a line in a specific buffer
2541 *
2542 * "will_change": if TRUE mark the buffer dirty (chars in the line will be
2543 * changed)
2544 */
2545 char_u *
2546ml_get_buf(
2547 buf_T *buf,
2548 linenr_T lnum,
2549 int will_change) // line will be changed
2550{
2551 bhdr_T *hp;
2552 DATA_BL *dp;
2553 static int recursive = 0;
2554
2555 if (lnum > buf->b_ml.ml_line_count) // invalid line number
2556 {
2557 if (recursive == 0)
2558 {
2559 // Avoid giving this message for a recursive call, may happen when
2560 // the GUI redraws part of the text.
2561 ++recursive;
2562 siemsg(_("E315: ml_get: invalid lnum: %ld")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E315: ml_get: invalid lnum: %ld"
), 5), lnum);
2563 --recursive;
2564 }
2565errorret:
2566 STRCPY(IObuff, "???")strcpy((char *)(IObuff), (char *)("???"));
2567 buf->b_ml.ml_line_len = 4;
2568 return IObuff;
2569 }
2570 if (lnum <= 0) // pretend line 0 is line 1
2571 lnum = 1;
2572
2573 if (buf->b_ml.ml_mfp == NULL((void*)0)) // there are no lines
2574 {
2575 buf->b_ml.ml_line_len = 1;
2576 return (char_u *)"";
2577 }
2578
2579 /*
2580 * See if it is the same line as requested last time.
2581 * Otherwise may need to flush last used line.
2582 * Don't use the last used line when 'swapfile' is reset, need to load all
2583 * blocks.
2584 */
2585 if (buf->b_ml.ml_line_lnum != lnum || mf_dont_release)
2586 {
2587 unsigned start, end;
2588 colnr_T len;
2589 int idx;
2590
2591 ml_flush_line(buf);
2592
2593 /*
2594 * Find the data block containing the line.
2595 * This also fills the stack with the blocks from the root to the data
2596 * block and releases any locked block.
2597 */
2598 if ((hp = ml_find_line(buf, lnum, ML_FIND0x13)) == NULL((void*)0))
2599 {
2600 if (recursive == 0)
2601 {
2602 // Avoid giving this message for a recursive call, may happen
2603 // when the GUI redraws part of the text.
2604 ++recursive;
2605 get_trans_bufname(buf);
2606 shorten_dir(NameBuff);
2607 siemsg(_("E316: ml_get: cannot find line %ld in buffer %d %s")dcgettext (((void*)0), (char *)("E316: ml_get: cannot find line %ld in buffer %d %s"
), 5),
2608 lnum, buf->b_fnum, NameBuff);
2609 --recursive;
2610 }
2611 goto errorret;
2612 }
2613
2614 dp = (DATA_BL *)(hp->bh_data);
2615
2616 idx = lnum - buf->b_ml.ml_locked_low;
2617 start = ((dp->db_index[idx]) & DB_INDEX_MASK(~((unsigned)1 << ((sizeof(unsigned) * 8) - 1))));
2618 // The text ends where the previous line starts. The first line ends
2619 // at the end of the block.
2620 if (idx == 0)
2621 end = dp->db_txt_end;
2622 else
2623 end = ((dp->db_index[idx - 1]) & DB_INDEX_MASK(~((unsigned)1 << ((sizeof(unsigned) * 8) - 1))));
2624 len = end - start;
2625
2626 buf->b_ml.ml_line_ptr = (char_u *)dp + start;
2627 buf->b_ml.ml_line_len = len;
2628 buf->b_ml.ml_line_lnum = lnum;
2629 buf->b_ml.ml_flags &= ~ML_LINE_DIRTY2;
2630 }
2631 if (will_change)
2632 buf->b_ml.ml_flags |= (ML_LOCKED_DIRTY4 | ML_LOCKED_POS8);
2633
2634 return buf->b_ml.ml_line_ptr;
2635}

2637/*
2638 * Check if a line that was just obtained by a call to ml_get
2639 * is in allocated memory.
2640 */
2641 int
2642ml_line_alloced(void)
2643{
2644 return (curbuf->b_ml.ml_flags & ML_LINE_DIRTY2);
2645}

2647#ifdef FEAT_PROP_POPUP

2650 */
2651 static void
2652add_text_props_for_append(

2689 {
2690 mch_memmove(&prop, props + n * sizeof(textprop_T),memmove((char *)(&prop), (char *)(props + n * sizeof(textprop_T
)), sizeof(textprop_T))

2691 sizeof(textprop_T))memmove((char *)(&prop), (char *)(props + n * sizeof(textprop_T
)), sizeof(textprop_T));
2692 if (prop.tp_flags & TP_FLAG_CONT_NEXT1)
2693 {
2694 if (round == 2)
2695 {
2696 prop.tp_flags |= TP_FLAG_CONT_PREV2;
2697 prop.tp_col = 1;
2698 prop.tp_len = *len; // not exactly the right length
2699 mch_memmove(new_line + *len + new_prop_countmemmove((char *)(new_line + *len + new_prop_count * sizeof(textprop_T
)), (char *)(&prop), sizeof(textprop_T))
2700 * sizeof(textprop_T), &prop, sizeof(textprop_T))memmove((char *)(new_line + *len + new_prop_count * sizeof(textprop_T
)), (char *)(&prop), sizeof(textprop_T));
